lessons.lesson: Lesson 1 等他回电话 Waiting for him to call back

sentences.chinese: 喂，我是林大中，请问王先生在吗？
sentences.pinyin: Wèi, wǒ shì Lín Dàzhōng, qǐng wèn Wáng Xiānshēng zài ma?
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: Hello, this is Lin DaZhong. Is Mr. Wang in?

sentences.chinese: 对不起，他不在，我是他太太，请问有什么事吗？
sentences.pinyin: Duìbùqǐ, tā bù zài, wǒ shì tā tài tài, qǐng wèn yǒu shénme shì ma?
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: I’m sorry, he’s not in. I am his wife. May I ask what you are calling about?

sentences.chinese: 王太太，你好，是这样的，因为有位同学从台北来，所以我请了几位朋友，明天晚上六点钟，在梅花饭店吃饭。
sentences.pinyin: Wáng Tàitài, nǐ hǎo, shì zhè yàng de, yīnwèi yǒu wèi tóngxué cóng Táiběi lái, suǒyǐ wǒ qǐngle jǐ wèi péngyou, míngtiān wǎnshang liù diǎnzhōng, zài Méihuā Fàndiàn chīfàn.
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: How are you, Mrs. Wang? The fact is that an old classmate came all the way from Taipei, so I am inviting some friends to a dinner at the Plum Blossoms Restaurant tomorrow evening at six. I wonder if Mr. Wang could join us?

sentences.chinese: 因该么有问题，不不过还是得问问他。请你留个电话号码，号码？
sentences.pinyin: Yīngāi méi yǒu wèntí, bù bùguò háishì děi wèn wèn tā. Qǐng nǐ liú gè diànhuà hàomǎ, hàomǎ?
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: There shouldn’t be any problem, but I should still ask him about it when he gets back. Could you please leave your telephone number?

sentences.pinyin: Wǒ de diànhuà shì 7214385.
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: My number is 7214385.

sentences.chinese: 好的，等他回来我会告诉他，请他回你的电话。
sentences.pinyin: Hǎo de, děng tā huílái wǒ huì gàosù tā, qǐng tā huí nǐ de diànhuà.
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: Ok, I’ll tell him to call you back when he returns.

sentences.chinese: 谢谢你，我等他回话。
sentences.pinyin: Xièxiè nǐ, wǒ děng tā huí huà.
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: Thanks a lot, I’ll wait for him to call back.

lessons.lesson: Lesson 2 为什么我无法通过 Why Can’t I Get Through

sentences.chinese: 怎么打不通呢?
sentences.pinyin: Zěnme dǎ bùtōng ne?
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: Why can’t I get through?

sentences.chinese: 是在讲话中吗？
sentences.pinyin: Shì zài jiǎnghuà zhōng ma?
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: Is it because someone’s on the line?

sentences.chinese: 不是
sentences.pinyin: Bù shì
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: No

sentences.chinese: 是电话坏了吗？
sentences.pinyin: Shì diànhuà huài le ma?
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: Maybe the telephone isn’t working.

sentences.chinese: 也不是, 是没人接，会不就是电话号码错了
sentences.pinyin: Yě bù shì, shì méi rén jiē, huì bù jiù shì diànhuà hàomǎ cuò le
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: No, no one is at home. Could it be that you’ve got the wrong number?

sentences.chinese: 因该不会
sentences.pinyin: Yīngāi bù huì
sentences.english: Mrs. Wang: It shouldn’t.

sentences.chinese: 那么我再试试看
sentences.pinyin: Nàme wǒ zài shì shì kàn
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: I’ll try one more time.

sentences.chinese: 喂！
sentences.pinyin: Wèi!
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: Hello!

sentences.chinese: 是大众吗？我视频啊。怎么刚才没人打电话？
sentences.pinyin: Shì dàzhòng ma? Wǒ shì píngā. Zěnme gāngcái méi rén dǎ diànhuà?
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: Is this DaZhong? This is Shiping. Why didn’t anybody answer the phone just now?

sentences.chinese: 刚才我在洗手间，一听见电话铃声，就赶快出来，可是你已经挂断了。
sentences.pinyin: Gāngcái wǒ zài xǐshǒujiān, yì tīngjiàn diànhuà língshēng, jiù gǎnkuài chūlái, kěshì nǐ yǐjīng guàduàn le.
sentences.english: Mr. Lin: I was in the bathroom. I hurried to answer the phone when it rang, but you hang up.

sentences.chinese: 对不起，我是要告诉你我明天准时到
sentences.pinyin: Duìbùqǐ, wǒ shì yào gàosù nǐ wǒ míngtiān zhǔnshídào
sentences.english: Mr. Wang: I’m sorry, I just wanted to tell you that I’ll be there on time tomorrow.

lessons.lesson: Lesson 3 到我家来玩 Come to My Home

sentences.chinese: 你一个人住在外面，一定很不方便
sentences.pinyin: Nǐ yígèrén zhù zài wàimiàn, yídìng hěn bù fāngbiàn
sentences.english: DaZhong: It must be very inconvenient to live by yourself?

sentences.chinese: 是的，我很想家，所以我周末常回去
sentences.pinyin: Shìde, wǒ hěn xiǎng jiā, suǒyǐ wǒ zhōumò cháng huíqù
sentences.english: Shiping: Yes, I miss my family, so I often go home on weekends.

sentences.chinese: 这个周末你到我家来玩两天吧！
sentences.pinyin: Zhège zhōumò nǐ dào wǒ jiā lái wán liǎng tiān ba!
sentences.english: DaZhong: Can you come to my house this weekend?

sentences.chinese: 会不会太麻烦你们？
sentences.pinyin: Huì bù huì tài máfan nǐmen?
sentences.english: Shiping: Would it be much trouble for you?

sentences.chinese: 不久的，你不要客气，我父母亲很观影客人
sentences.pinyin: Bù jiǔ de, nǐ bù yào kèqì, wǒ fùmǔqīn hěn guānyǐng kèrén
sentences.english: DaZhong: It’s not. My parents welcome my friends.

sentences.chinese: 住在你家方便吗
sentences.pinyin: Zhù zài nǐ jiā fāngbiàn ma?
sentences.english: Shiping: Is it convenient to stay in your house?

sentences.chinese: 非常方便，我家有好几间卧房，客厅，饭厅也不小，要是天气好的话还可以在院子里打球。
sentences.pinyin: Fēicháng fāngbiàn, wǒ jiā yǒu hǎojǐ jiān wòfáng, kètīng, fàntīng yě bù xiǎo, yàoshi tiānqì hǎo dehuà hái kěyǐ zài yuànzi lǐ dǎqiú.
sentences.english: DaZhong: Very convenient. We have many bedrooms. The living room and the dining room are big too. If the weather is nice, we can also play ball in the yard.

sentences.chinese: 太好了，我很喜欢打球。
sentences.pinyin: Tài hǎo le, wǒ hěn xǐhuān dǎqiú.
sentences.english: Shiping: Good. I like to play ball.

sentences.chinese: 那么周末我来接你
sentences.pinyin: Nàme zhōumò wǒ lái jiē nǐ
sentences.english: DaZhong: Then, I will pick you up this weekend.

sentences.chinese: 不用了，给我你家的地址，我一定找得到
sentences.pinyin: Bùyòng le, gěi wǒ nǐ jiā de dìzhǐ, wǒ yídìng zhǎo dédào
sentences.english: Shiping: No, you don’t need to. If you give me your address, I’m sure I can find it.

sentences.chinese: 欢迎，欢迎，你来的很准时
sentences.pinyin: Huānyíng, huānyíng, nǐ lái de hěn zhǔnshí
sentences.english: DaZhong: Welcome! Welcome! You are very punctual.

sentences.chinese: 你家很好找，我一号就到了
sentences.pinyin: Nǐ jiā hěn hǎo zhǎo, wǒ yī hào jiù zhǎo dàole
sentences.english: Shiping: Your house is easy to find. I found it without any problems.

sentences.chinese: 上次小王来，找了半天，也没找到
sentences.pinyin: Shàng cì xiǎo wáng lái, zhǎole bàntiān, yě méi zhǎodào
sentences.english: DaZhong: Last time, little Wang had a lot of trouble finding it.

sentences.chinese: 这么说，我比他聪明，是不是？
sentences.pinyin: Zhème shuō, wǒ bǐ tā cōngmíng, shì bù shì?
sentences.english: Shiping: Then I’m smarter, right?

sentences.chinese: 上次迷路的是，你好像忘记了
sentences.pinyin: Shàng cì mílù de shì, nǐ hǎoxiàng wàngjì le
sentences.english: DaZhong: You seem to have forgotten your last experience.

sentences.chinese: 那是因为你一直跟我说话，所以我忘了转弯。
sentences.pinyin: Nà shì yīnwèi nǐ yīzhí gēn wǒ shuōhuà, suǒyǐ wǒ wàngle zhuǎnwān.
sentences.english: Shiping: Last time I got lost because you were talking to me all the time, and I forgot to turn.

sentences.chinese: 不是吧，是在改左转的时候，你右转了。
sentences.pinyin: Bù shì ba, shì zài gǎi zuǒzhuǎn de shíhou, nǐ yòu zhuǎnle.
sentences.english: DaZhong: No, I think you turned the wrong way.

sentences.chinese: 真的吗？我怎么不记得了
sentences.pinyin: Zhēn de ma? Wǒ zěnme bù jìdé le
sentences.english: Shiping: Really? Funny, I don’t remember that.

sentences.chinese: 快进去吧！我父母亲都等着看你呢。
sentences.pinyin: Kuàijìnqù ba! Wǒ fùmǔqīn dōu děngzhe kàn nǐ ne.
sentences.english: DaZhong: Come on. My parents are waiting to meet you.

lessons.lesson: Lesson 5 我如何到达那里 How do I Get There?

sentences.chinese: 先生，请问到第一银行怎么走？
sentences.pinyin: Xiānshēng, qǐng wèndào dì yī yínháng zěnme zǒu?
sentences.english: DaZhong: Sir, can you tell me how I can get to the First National Bank?

sentences.chinese: 你先向右走，到十字路口左转，然后再一直走过两个红路灯就到中山北路了。
sentences.pinyin: Nǐ xiān xiàng yòu zǒu, dào shízì lùkǒu zuǒzhuǎn, ránhòu zài yìzhí zǒuguò liǎnggè hóng lùdēng jiùdào zhōngshānběilù le.
sentences.english: Shiping: Turn to the right first. Turn left at the first intersection. Then walk two blocks, and you’ll be at Zhongshan North Road.

sentences.chinese: 第一银行在中山北路吗？
sentences.pinyin: Dì yī yínháng zài zhōngshānběilù ma?
sentences.english: DaZhong: Is the First National Bank on Zhongshan North Road?

sentences.chinese: 是的，在一家百货公司对面
sentences.pinyin: Shì de, zài yìjiā bǎihuògōngsī duìmiàn
sentences.english: Shiping: Yes, it’s right in front of a department store.

sentences.chinese: 我知道了，那家百货公司很大
sentences.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdàole, nà jiā bǎihuògōngsī hěndà
sentences.english: DaZhong: I know. That department store is very big.

sentences.chinese: 不过，过马路要小心，那条路上车子很多
sentences.pinyin: Búguò, guò mǎlù yào xiǎoxīn, nà tiáo lùshang chēzi hěnduō
sentences.english: Shiping: But be careful when you cross the street. There are a lot of cars.

sentences.chinese: 好的，我走地下道，谢谢你
sentences.pinyin: Hǎode, wǒ zǒudexiàdào, xièxiènǐ
sentences.english: DaZhong: Ok, I’ll take the underground passage. Thank you!
